name: Shieldleaf
description: Astilboides tabularis, commonly known as Shieldleaf or Umbrella Plant, is a perennial plant native to northeastern China, Korea, and parts of Russia. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and features large, round to kidney-shaped, shield-like leaves (30-60 cm across) that are dark green with prominent veins and serrated margins. The leaves are held on long petioles and create a distinctive umbrella-like appearance. The plant displays an upright, clumping growth habit and typically reaches 60-120 cm in height. It produces small, white to cream-colored flowers in tall, plume-like inflorescences in summer. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds dramatic interest with its large, shield-like leaves. It's popular among plant enthusiasts for its distinctive foliage.
